text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['5. miarap', '打群架', 'Mob fight', '', 'si apen Kotan/Jinovoy (M, 75, Yayo)', '王仁德，男，75，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: ika-pat na araw am, sinodo mi-arap sira, tarek sira do ingato a, tarek sira do ilaod,
S.TRANSL: 第四天，由於村裡的上部落與下部落發生群架的事件
After four days, the upper section of the tribe and the lower section of the tribe had a mob fight.

S.FORM: ta ji mi-awa o ili ta ya, to da niw-niwciw-a o paci-agom-an ko ori a sira do ilaod ito a,
S.TRANSL: 我們村莊分成上部落與下部落。當時我個人比較偏向的下部落被上部落的人給追逐了
Our village split into the upper and lower sections and had a fight. The lower section, which I favored, was chased by the upper section.

S.FORM: “ta to kamo a-ciwciw, ta ma-ngay jinio o tana am, ”mi-gesa-gesah namen no kominazazang am ori a,
S.TRANSL: 我對下部落的人說，“你們幹麼嚇跑，泥巴打到身上會（怎樣？） ；那時候，我們雙方是用kominazazang互擲對方的”
“Why were you so easily chased around? If the mud hits you, (so what?)” I said to the people of the lower section. At that time each section was throwing kominazazang at the other.

S.FORM: “a ma-ngay jinio o tana am, ma-kong? ingn-en nio rana o tana”, to ko maci-angay jira, to ko ngomo-ngomon do gesah da,
S.TRANSL: “泥巴打到你們身上有什麼關係，被泥巴打到就叫痛了唷？” 於是我加入了他們的行列，並陷入泥巴戰之中
“It doesn’t hurt when you are hit with mud.” I joined in and got covered with mud.

S.FORM: to ko angay do ma-karang a tokad no mina ora da nira mina do Samorangan ito am,
S.TRANSL: 後來我到地勢較高的si Samorangan他們的田埂上去
I climbed to si Samorangan’s field where the ground was higher,

S.FORM: to ko pa-libetbét-a jira pi-ta-tahapis-en am,
S.TRANSL: 我抓起了泥巴然後連續擲向對方去
picked up mud, and tossed it at the opposition continuously.

S.FORM: to ko a-nao o asa aka tao do moing na am, “ka-kma si mina ama mo, ta ya ko ji maka-cita” koan na am, ma-ngay mi-ramon am,
S.TRANSL: 結果有一個被我丟中了臉上，他就罵說“該死的，害我看不見” ，然後就去洗臉
I hit one person in the face, and he cursed, “Shit, I can’t see a thing.” He turned back for home to wash his face.

S.FORM: mi-alihóshos ko a g-om-cin am, to ko ang-tog do tey-rahem am, o lima ko am, to ko pa-simzod-a am to-da vaci a,
S.TRANSL: 當我正轉身準備下去的時候，一不小心就栽進了芋頭田裡去，我手一甩竟脫臼了
As I turned to go back down, I slipped and fell head over heals into a taro field, and my arm was dislocated.

S.FORM: “ka-kma so inanatan nio”, ori a ka-ngay da ma-hap jiaken a,
S.TRANSL: “可惡！” 然後他們（我的同伴）就都來扶我
“Shit!” my friends picked me up.

S.FORM: “ta si ke-hakay ta” koan da am, koan na ni mina men Samorang ito a rak-rakeh aka niaken,
S.TRANSL: 同伴中，比我年長的si aman Samorang，看到我的情況，就說“啊呀，我們的朋友！”
Among my friends, si aman Samorang, who was older, saw my condition, and said, “Look at our friend.”

S.FORM: “ji tamo rana mi-arap, ta ya ni-ma-vaci o lima ni ke-hakay ta”,
S.TRANSL: “好了，大家別打了，我們朋友的手斷（脫臼）了”
“Okay, everyone, stop fighting. Our friend’s arm is broken.”

S.FORM: ka-koa-koan no ka-liman namen ori a akma namen i-ka-liman am, to sia mí-min a m-ai a ma-hap jiaken a.
S.TRANSL: 即便是與我們對立的上部落，也都趕過來把我扶起來
At the time even the people from the upper section came down to help me up.

S.FORM: maka-veyvow rana minipinizozongan da men ikoa a ka-tangked namen ori a ya ma-mareng so vahay ori am, ori o ni-mi-ma-hap jiaken a,
S.TRANSL: 我們家隔壁那個正在蓋房子的某人當時已經很大了（已是成年），就是他將我抱起來的
The guy who is right now building the house next door is the one who pulled me up. He was old enough and into his adulthood at that time.

S.FORM: to na napopo-a yaken a, a ka-teng-an pa o lima ko an, to na nenet-a o lima ko am,
S.TRANSL: 他把我抱起來之後，就抓了著我的手一拉，痛得我都快要不行了
After he picked me up, he pulled on my arm. My arm was hurting like hell.

S.FORM: “pak!” koan no lima ko am, to mi-sonong am, ji ko ni-ma-’amang a.
S.TRANSL: 我的手“啪” 的一聲拉直了，我當場痛得昏了過去
There was a popping sound as my arm straightened, and the pain made me faint.

S.FORM: m-oli rana sira Ina icialaw am, “ya kamo mi jino a aro a tao ya?”
S.TRANSL: 當我的父母親從山上回到家時，“你們這麼多人來做什麼？”
“Why is everyone here?” my parents asked as they came down from the mountains.

S.FORM: “ya ni-ma-vaci o lima ni ke-hakay”,
S.TRANSL: “我們朋友的手斷了”
“Our friend’s arm got broken.”

S.FORM: “a ya ka pa ni-ma-kongo sipaka, ya ka ni-ma-kongo, mo pi-aavoada a, ka pa ni-ma-kongo?”,
S.TRANSL: “啊喲，你怎麼又 ？我的寶貝呀，你到底怎麼了？”
“Oh, what now? Oh, my boy, what were you doing?”

S.FORM: “ya ni-ma-vaci o lima ko”, “ta ya mo ji maka-doa-raw-i a, mo ka-pa-nnga-nngan ya”,
S.TRANSL: “我的手斷了” ，“你是怎麼了，怎麼不到兩天，你就又受傷了呢？”
“My arm got broken.” “Why? It hasn’t even been two days and you hurt yourself again?”

S.FORM: ori o ya ko kasi-kasi-sinmo-en noka-li-alikey ko a ji a-ni-mi-walam a,
S.TRANSL: 以上就是我小時候的親身經歷，因為好動而常常發生受傷的事情
This is my personal experience. I always hurt myself because I could not slow down.

S.FORM: to da na moko-mok-i yaken am, ta ka-teng-an pa an?
S.TRANSL: 我完全陷入了泥戰之中；混亂到不知如何形容那場面
They ganged up on me. All of us were completely involved in the fight, and the confusion was unimaginable.
